Post (John R.) Collection on Lawrence Clark Powell Material
titlestmt.author: Frank Novak

titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the John R. Post Collection of Lawrence Clark Powell Material
titlepage.publisher:
Department of Special Collections and University Archives
Stanford University Libraries
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 2006 The Board of Trustees of Stanford University. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: John R. Post collection of Lawrence Clark Powell material

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: The collection contains specially-printed keepsakes, broadsides, magazines, photographs, tapes and cds, and other miscellaneous items either written by, or about, Lawrence Clark Powell, UCLA librarian and "bookman."
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: English

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research; materials must be requested at least 24 hours in advance of intended use.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John R. Post collection of Lawrence Clark Powell material, M1419. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. John R. Post, 2003. Accession 2004-029.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This collection includes: 1. Special printings of limited editions for use as keepsakes, personal gifts, etc.; 2. Broadsides, including a special series of 12, 1953-1958, printed for Powell, as well as 7 others using quotations from various literary figures. 3. Magazines (Arizona Highways, New Mexico Magazine, and Westways) with articles by Powell. Also Hoja Volante, a publication of the Zamorano Club of Los Angeles contains articles by Powell. 4. UCLA publications for the libraries including prefaces, forewords, and essays by Powell. 5. Miscellaneous articles by Powell in diverse journals, reprints, magazines, newspaper clippings, book publication announcements, book club flyers and book dealer catalogues. 6. Audio tapes, CD's and video. The tapes and CD's were recorded by Powell in his home in Tucson, AZ, 1997-1998. The video is about Henry Miller with a small segment with Powell. 7. Photographs, seven prints, 1950-1981 and nd.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.head: Subjects
controlaccess.subject: American literature--20th century.

did.unittitle: Rivers, by Harvey Fergusson: Number Elevenof Southwest Broadsides 1956

scopecontent.p: Printed by Raphael Gonsalves and Edward Possnecke in the Graphic Arts Laboratories of Los Angeles City College under the supervision of Richard Hoffman. The illustration , drawn and hand cut by Gonsalves. was produced in 5 colors by the silk screen process. A few copies on Italian hand made Umbria paper, the rest on Shadowmould Cover 1956. 20 x20 inches
